section.title: 2.1: Quests and combat, unlock Miscellania
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 38
steps.description: Do Throne of Miscellania and Royal Trouble (fairy ring CIP to get there), obtain 100% support (buying flowers from the flower girl or chopping Etceteria teak logs), kill Rabbits for Rag and Bone Man II, deposit 600k gp (or: your entire cash stack) in Misc and set it to 10 mahogany 5 maple. The mahogany logs are for bird runs (levels 49-80) , the maples for arrow shafts for fletching. Also visit at least once/twice a week to restore the support to 100% (buying flowers from the flower girl or raking the herb patch). The gp will sit below 675k constantly, so your kingdom will not produce the maximum amount of resources possible per day. This is fine since we have enough time, we are only interested in getting the maximum amount of resources for our money. We will leave Misc running for up to 11 days and then collect the money that remains (you may choose to leave it running for shorter, once the gp stack gets low it really doesn't matter much. Make sure not to exceed 11 days though! ). Level 49-80 hunter is 1974 mahogany logs, so that is your target from misc. Likely your hunter level is already a bit higher, in which case you need fewer logs (960 xp each). If you are running low on digsite pendants buy 80 rubies in Ardougne and make new digsites. Make sure to keep doing bird runs always. If your hunter is at least level 65 always chase magpie implings, along with the Taverley crystal chest they are the best way to get a runite bar for Song of the Elves.

section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 39
steps.description: Shades of Mort'ton minigame teleport , go to the Haunted Mine. Mine a mithril ore for the diary (take the mine key for fast access). Visit the Lair of Tarn Razorlor, start and complete the miniquest (and kill a terror dog in the process).

go to the Haunted Mine.
Mine a mithril ore for the diary (take the mine key for fast access).

section.title: 2.1: Quests and combat, unlock Miscellania
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 40
steps.description: Do barbarian fishing to 65 agility (~88 fishing) at CoX (buy as many feathers as needed), make sure to do Barblore as much as possible. Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking for RFD/Awowogei. You can get to the fishing spot by using the Arceuus Library teleport (the Arceuus spell, not the Kharedst's) into the minecart to get back. This is faster than the Kharedst's to Lovakengj. Example setup here - the gp predates the Zeah favour rework and is not necessary. Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking later. If you decide not to, then you'll have to do Mess Hall, which is slower. For an explanation on the Mount Quidamortem barblore (can be afked, just bank the sturgeons), see 20230127LowLevelBarblore . Warning: this document is several years out of date, and just covers the basic idea. Maintain cats, bird runs, contracts and (hardwood and fruit) tree runs, and optionally also include herb runs. Collect misc for mahogany logs for bird runs whenever necessary. If you run out of/low on digsite pendants go buy ~80 more rubies in a gem shop (Ardougne/Kourend pre completing Moons of Peril, Cam Torum after as it is cheaper and closer to a bank). If you prefer to do this as a low effort/afk activity you may instead choose to weave the fishing in during other steps (instead of grinding this all at once). The levels are not needed until step 64 of this chapter . Depending on your fishing rate your 2 weeks of Misc could be over during this step, make sure to take out the remaining GP at that point (or on some future step, whenever it happens). If you run out of soul runes go buy 200 more for teleports(/hourlies).

Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking later.
If you decide not to, then you'll have to do Mess Hall, which is slower.
For an explanation on the Mount Quidamortem barblore (can be afked, just bank the sturgeons), see 20230127LowLevelBarblore .
Warning: this document is several years out of date, and just covers the basic idea.
Maintain cats, bird runs, contracts and (hardwood and fruit) tree runs, and optionally also include herb runs.
Collect misc for mahogany logs for bird runs whenever necessary.
If you run out of/low on digsite pendants go buy ~80 more rubies in a gem shop (Ardougne/Kourend pre completing Moons of Peril, Cam Torum after as it is cheaper and closer to a bank).
If you prefer to do this as a low effort/afk activity you may instead choose to weave the fishing in during other steps (instead of grinding this all at once).
The levels are not needed until step 64 of this chapter .
Depending on your fishing rate your 2 weeks of Misc could be over during this step
make sure to take out the remaining GP at that point (or on some future step, whenever it happens).
If you run out of soul runes go buy 200 more for teleports(/hourlies).

Make a silvthrill rod at the Neitiznot furnace. Enchant your silvthrill rod. Sell your berserker helm back to Skulgrimen after you've obtained the Helm of Neitiznot .

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 63
steps.description: MLM for coal and gem bag (repair the strut along the way for the diary). Do low level group Volcanic Mine (this is a bit of a trek) for the prospector hat, and optionally for the rest of the gear as well. Check out https://discord.gg/FXPUrUp for finding teams. Complete the Falador hard diary step. Complete the Falador easy diary, putting the lamp on slayer. At MLM after hourlies you can run back from the Falador patch after a herb run, or use the Arceuus Spawn Point teleport to get back to Falador. Similar to the barbarian fishing you can choose to spread this out over multiple steps, although this time you need at least 72 mining by step 64 and you need to have completed MLM by step 73. If you think the coal and gem bag are not useful enough you can instead opt to first get ~68-70 mining through other means (in particular, sandstone or blast mining). This option will mean you will be short on gp and have to make a set of air staves from scratch to adjust. There is a tick manipulation method to significantly increase the speed of Motherload Mine (credit to Port Khazard and Drgn for discovering this). You can find a short example clip of this here: https://imgur.com/a/UkY7Ytj (the clip has a metronome sound for timing). The method works as follows: You need an adamant pickaxe, other tiers don't work. The method, explained below in more detail, works the same way you would 3t mine (e.g. 3s1g, or granite) but on a successful mine, click the next ore again on the xp drop, so that the total cycle is 4t on a success and 3t on a failure. Note that 'click' here means 'click processed on this tick', so you have to give the input 1t earlier. tick 1: herb tar rock 1t away tick 2: interact tick 3: still interacting tick 4: herb tar rock 1t away (does nothing if succeeded) - this is the tick 1 of the next cycle if you failed tick 5: click same rock u did in tick 4 (incase you succeeded) - this is the tick 1 of the next cycle if you succeeded Theoretically this represents an increase of approximately 40% in xp/hr at level 70 mining, though realistically the gains will be lower due to having to move to a new spot more often. OSRSMLMMotherlodeMineSpot.png shows a recommended location (in the southwest corner) for having multiple veins close to one another. Alternatively you can pick a closer spot to the deposit chute but have to adapt more to veins depleting. 3t/4t (3.5t?) double roll motherlode mine example shows the method in full, with an explanation in the description of the video. Tick manip Motherlode Mine example shows a non-optimised example clip, slightly north of the recommended spot. Your ~11 days of Misc should be more than over by now (they probably were a long time ago), make sure to take out the remaining GP (fill up the cash stack to at least 200k total) if you haven't already even if the time hasn't passed.

instructions.text: MLM for coal and gem bag (repair the strut along the way for the diary).
Do low level group Volcanic Mine (this is a bit of a trek) for the prospector hat, and optionally for the rest of the gear as well.
Check out https://discord.gg/FXPUrUp for finding teams.
Complete the Falador hard diary step.
Complete the Falador easy diary, putting the lamp on slayer.

click the next ore again on the xp drop, so that the total cycle is 4t on a success and 3t on a failure.

Note that 'click' here means 'click processed on this tick', so you have to give the input 1t earlier. tick 1: herb tar rock 1t away tick 2: interact tick 3: still interacting tick 4: herb tar rock 1t away (does nothing if succeeded) - this is the tick 1 of the next cycle if you failed tick 5: click same rock u did in tick 4 (incase you succeeded) - this is the tick 1 of the next cycle if you succeeded Theoretically this represents an increase of approximately 40% in xp/hr at level 70 mining, though realistically the gains will be lower due to having to move to a new spot more often.
OSRSMLMMotherlodeMineSpot.png shows a recommended location (in the southwest corner) for having multiple veins close to one another.

Alternatively you can pick a closer spot to the deposit chute but have to adapt more to veins depleting. 3t/4t (3.5t?) double roll motherlode mine example shows the method in full, with an explanation in the description of the video.
Tick manip Motherlode Mine example shows a non-optimised example clip, slightly north of the recommended spot.
Your ~11 days of Misc should be more than over by now (they probably were a long time ago)
make sure to take out the remaining GP (fill up the cash stack to at least 200k total) if you haven't already even if the time hasn't passed.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 64
steps.description: Start Swan Song, continue Eagles' Peak until you need to report back to Charlie (last step). Visit the Wise Old Man in Draynor Village . V isit Charlie to complete Eagles' Peak, use a necklace of passage to Eagles Eyrie and take multiple eagle rides (back and forth to each location, finishing in the desert ) to progress three diaries. Run to the Shantay Pass to collect the Desert medium diary reward and put the lamp on Slayer. Take the fairy ring to the Piscatoris hunter area (AKQ), optional: when in the Piscatoris region box trap a ferret and then rabbit snare + ferret to catch a rabbit for a rabbit's foot, then string it for extra eggs on future bird runs, r un to Piscatoris and continue Swan Song. Complete Swan Song. Start and complete Making Friends with My Arm, boosting your agility level with an agility potion if necessary. Good herb runs start here. Make the Fire of Nourishment (three Fires of Eternal Light optional), grab an iron pickaxe, mine all the basalt (using your rune pickaxe) and salts for all the fires, make 100 Stony basalt and 100 Icy basalt. In total this requires 200 basalt, 1050 Efh, 1000 Urt and 1300 Te salt. Optional: also make the Fire of Dehumidification and the Fire of Unseasonal Warmth +(350 Efh, 150 Te and 400 Urt salt).

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 65
steps.description: Do barbarian fishing to 99 fishing at CoX (buy as many feathers as needed), make sure to do Barblore as much as possible. Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking for RFD/Awowogei. NOTE: if you are not aiming to max in the future you can skip this step, and instead train agility to level 72 manually (at Seers rooftops). You can get to the fishing spot by using the Arceuus Library teleport (the Arceuus spell, not the Kharedst's) into the minecart to get back. This is faster than the Kharedst's to Lovakengj. Example setup here - the gp predates the Zeah favour rework and is not necessary. Cut-eat the fish for cooking xp, you will need at least level 70 cooking later. If you decide not to, then you'll have to do Mess Hall, which is slower. For an explanation on the Mount Quidamortem barblore (can be afked, just bank the sturgeons), see 20230127LowLevelBarblore . Warning: this document is several years out of date, and just covers the basic idea. When you hit 66 herblore make a super defence potion in the Fremennik province for the Fremennik hard diary. Maintain hourlies (contracts, bird runs, hardwood and fruit tree runs, herb runs, optionally seaweed - you will never need more than 12.5k seaweed). You can stop growing cats if you want though it's still good to continue, after all you're fishing for cat food nonstop. Optional alternative: use the firefighter method Tempoross - 80+ Permits/Hour - Solo Firefight Method at Tempoross for high points/hr to get a fishing barrel, then resume the barbarian fishing grind.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 66
steps.description: Swap to the regular spellbook. Complete Recipe for Disaster by following the steps below: Dueling ring to Al Kharid, take the gnome glider to the Feldip Hills. Speak with Rantz to progress RFD/Skrach until you are asked to meet him in Karamja. (redirected) POH tab to Brimhaven, take the travel cart to Shilo village. Resume Legends' Quest all the way to the final step (have obtained the totem pole). While in the jungle chop a teak and mahogany log, collect a palm leaf (chop a palm tree) five times (drop and pick up), make and eat an oomlie wrap (kill an oomlie for food, use palm leaf, cook and eat), collect a vanilla pod along the way for RFD/Sir Amik Varze and kill a deathwing inside the Viyeldi caves for the diary. Head to the northwest of Tai Bwo Wannai village and light a fire on the coast for RFD/Skrach, take the boat back to Rantz and prepare a cooked jubbly. Ardougne Cloak into a fairy ring to the Legends' Guild (BLR), go inside and complete the quest, putting the lamps on herblore. Go back outside, take the fairy ring to Zanaris. Grind a sweetcorn into flour if you haven't yet, then go into the Evil Chicken's Lair and resume RFD/Varze until you have the brulee. Take the fairy ring CLR to Ape Atoll, do all of RFD/Awowogei up to and including the step where you have the cooked stuffed snake. Teleport to Lumbridge. Complete RFD (including the Culinaromancer fight), lamping Herblore. Buy barrows gloves.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 67
steps.description: If you cannot yet enter the Warriors' Guild (130 combined attack and strength), train your attack/strength with slayer tasks until you can (your goal is 60 atk 70 str). Enter the Warriors' Guild, kill cyclopes to get a dragon defender (bank some black knives along the way). Your attack and defence should both be at least level 60, if they are not train attack to 60 first, then defence to 60. After this train defence as high as it will go during the defender grind. If you do not get to level 60 defence from the dragon defender grind, train your defence to 60 with slayer tasks or sand crabs. Cheese potatoes are a reasonable food source for many situations (though worse than 15-healing premade gnome food). Buy 1000 of either of them. You may mix and match. Buy a defence potion. If you haven't already, go to either the PVP Arena or to NMZ and imbue your berserker ring and salve amulet. The PVP Arena method involves either an alt/friend to boost points (go at off-peak hours, hope to get matched with each other, quickly die to the other/kill the other for points, repeat) or just suiciding to randoms for quick points imbue scroll via pvp arena - losing method . For a guide on NMZ, see OSRSNMZGuide.txt or I figured out how Nightmare Zone points are calculated. New meta for AFKing with absorption pots to get good XP/hr and decent points/hr! : r/2007scape . Briefly, there are four main methods: Afk easy rumble: pick 5 high xp bosses, afk in easy rumble with absorption potions. 20 minute afk, medium xp, almost no points. Afk hard rumble: pick 5 high xp bosses, rock cake down to 1hp, absorption potions. ~8 minute afk (after that point your 1k charges are out and you have to cake back down and refill your absorptions), high xp, medium points. Hybrid hard rumble: following the reddit link, pick a mixture of bosses that give good points and are afk, then copy the method for afk hard rumble. ~8 minute afk, medium xp, good points. Active ('points') nmz: only disable the bosses in the list below. fight them actively. When annoying bosses pop up, ignore them until you roll ultimate power. Not afk, high xp, very high points. Corrupted Lizardman Elvarg Dad Glod The Recipe for Disaster bosses Giant Roc Barrelchest Elven traitor Essyllt Corsair Traitor Go to NMZ and collect enough points (using the above guide) for redirection scrolls. From here on you have redirected POH tabs for herb runs, tree runs and general use.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 68
steps.description: Tackle organised crime for intelligence along the way and hand it in at Captain Ginea for the diary. Catch a chinchompa in the Kourend Woodland. Collect T5 Shayzien outfit from the combat ring. Collect the medium Kourend & Kebos diary. Put the XP lamps on slayer. Do A Kingdom Divided (need to be on the normal spellbook, lamps on Slayer), using melee for the fights. Grab the skull near the Shayzien graveyard dungeon entrance and buy redberries in Kenelme's Wares (Piscarilius) along the way. Minigame teleport to Mort'ton, start and complete His Faithful Servants miniquest, which includes doing a complete barrows run (all six brothers). It is recommended to complete the Defence? What Defence? , Can't Touch Me , Pray for Success and optionally also Just Like That tasks on this run, dds speccing Karil (and hoping for good hits or resetting on a failure), maging the four melee brothers and meleeing Ahrim.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 69
steps.description: Kill green dragons with defensive melee and thralls until you reach level 65 defence. Do King's Ransom (XP on herblore), then the Knight Waves Training Grounds. Set your spawn point to Camelot. Use the bones at the Chaos Altar to get to 60+ prayer. Return to the green dragons, killing 1.3k total with defensive melee (to 70 defence, swap to accurate, i.e. attack training, after) banking both bones and hides using a looting bag. Along the way kill one mammoth and an ent, chopping some yew logs from the ent for the diary. The standard setup (with or without dragonfire potions) is: Helm of Neitiznot (risked), Dragon Scimitar, Dragon Defender, Amulet of Strength, Barrows gloves (+1), Proselyte top + bottom, Berserker Ring (i), Ardougne Cloak 1, Climbing Boots, Rada's Blessing 1, Resurrect Superior Skeletal/Ghostly thrall runes (unless you have access to the Greater spell at level 76, boostable from 73 with a Wizard's Mind Bomb. If so, use that instead) and book. Use a games necklace to Corporeal Beast then run east to get to the dragons (1250 or 1500 total level worlds are usually empty), and dueling rings back to Ferox to bank and restore. The example setup looks like this , although you may not need as much food. The best strategy for completing the Knight Wave Training Grounds is not flinching or poison, but simply fighting them using food and potions and letting the knights kill you once you run low on supplies. This will let you continue at the knight that killed you, making it very easy. The minigame is safe so HCIM can use this method too. This will get your defence to 70 (and, once you use the bones on the Chaos Altar, also prayer to 70), unlocking Piety. At some point your stats are high enough you might be within reach of completing the easy tier of the Combat Achievements, giving you a quick 5k xp lamp for a skill of your choice (probably herblore). HCIM: you can opt to train through calcified rocks in Varlamore instead, offering blessed bone shards at the liberation bowl. Note that this scales with your mining level, so optionally you could choose to do more mining (sandstone, granite or gem rocks) first.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 70
steps.description: Cash in the prayer xp at the Chaos Altar when convenient (use the suicide method at off-peak hours in random worlds recommended). If you have spare red topazes you can make burning amulets. After one of your inventories, run into the King Black Dragon Lair for the diary. Tele out to Ferox using a dueling ring or suicide. Pest control minigame teleport, do a novice and intermediate game of Pest Control. If you have enough fossils for three display cases and also completed Curse of the Empty Lord: Teleport to Varrock, pray at the altar in the palace with smite active. Build three fossil display cases and speak with the information clerk for xp, with historian Minas for an xp lamp and Orlando Smith for the diary. Collect the Varrock hard diary reward, putting the lamp on herblore. If you do not have enough fossils for two display cases postpone this to step 72.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 71
steps.description: Tan your green dragonhides into green dragon leather in Canifis. Make a green d'hide shield. Craft all remaining hides into green d'hide bodies. Alch the bodies (buying nature runes as necessary), e.g. during artefacts, underwater or afk. C ut your maple logs into arrow shafts (more artefacts), turning one into a maple shortbow for the diary while bankstanding at Seers. Also make a superantipoison potion there. Buy feathers (if you don't have plenty of those already from bird runs) to get to level 60 and make all into headless arrows, ideally while afking underwater to get more seaweed spores. Skills/quests met?:

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 72
steps.description: You should be level 51 (or higher) slayer. Make sure you have finished the Curse of the Empty Lord miniquest (if you haven't, do it now, putting the lamp on slayer). Teleport to Varrock, make sure to grab the Dragon'hai history book from the Varrock Palace library if you don't already have it, pray at the altar in the palace with smite active. Run east to the quetzal to go to Varlamore and do At First Light (note: the hunter rumours are currently not efficient, but if you want the rewards you can go for them at any time after this quest). During At First Light catch a Sunlight antelope (east end of the island, requires level 72 hunter, a teasing stick, knife and logs - grab a Trapper's tipple or two at the hunter's guild for a +2 boost if needed) and kill a jaguar for their fur. At the hunter's guild buy two mixed hide bases, and either pay Pellem to have the furs made into mixed hide boots (your best ranged boots for now) and a mixed hide cape (your best melee cape for now) or boost your crafting level if you have a spare mushroom pie to do it yourself. After this start and complete Perilous Moons (for the fights your dragon scimitar is fine, even for ice. Use the moss lizards and moonlight potions for supplies) and The Heart of Darkness. At the end of the quest travel to Tal Teklan (e.g. with the quetzal system). Buy four willow longbows at Arcuani's Archery Supplies. If you haven't done Scrambled! yet, do it now. Travel to Auburnvale (e.g. using the boat system). Start and complete Shadows of Custodia. Teleport out. Slay a Brine rat to complete the Fremennik medium diary, putting the lamp on herblore. Grab a rope, salve teleport, dip your enchanted silvthrill rod in the well to make the Rod of Ivandis and complete In Aid of the Myreque, Darkness of Hallowvale, A Taste of Hope and Sins of the Father (all lamps on herblore). Use the Efaritay's aid during the Vanstrom Klause fight in Sins of the Father - you should only need one ring, the second is spare in case you die or run out of charges. We will continue lamping slayer to level 58 for access to Cave Horrors, and after that put all lamps on herblore instead. You may choose to lamp more/less slayer depending on personal preference. There is more than enough lamp xp. This unlocks Yarnio's Baked Goods shop, a slightly better shop location for Garden pies than Romily Weaklax. You can now complete the Varrock hard diary, if you haven't before already., Teleport to Varrock and speak with the information clerk for xp, historian Minas for the Curse of the Empty Lord xp lamp and Orlando Smith for the diary. Put the lamps on slayer or herblore as mentioned previously.

Grab a rope, salve teleport, dip your enchanted silvthrill rod in the well to make the Rod of Ivandis and complete In Aid of the Myreque, Darkness of Hallowvale, A Taste of Hope and Sins of the Father (all lamps on herblore).
Use the Efaritay's aid during the Vanstrom Klause fight in Sins of the Father - you should only need one ring, the second is spare in case you die or run out of charges.
We will continue lamping slayer to level 58 for access to Cave Horrors, and after that put all lamps on herblore instead.
You may choose to lamp more/less slayer depending on personal preference.
There is more than enough lamp xp.
This unlocks Yarnio's Baked Goods shop, a slightly better shop location for Garden pies than Romily Weaklax.
You can now complete the Varrock hard diary, if you haven't before already.
Teleport to Varrock and speak with the information clerk for xp, historian Minas for the Curse of the Empty Lord xp lamp and Orlando Smith for the diary.
Put the lamps on slayer or herblore as mentioned previously.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 73
steps.description: Catch ~1.5k grey chins for level 55 ranging (at Soul Wars - you can take an axe to chop the nearby teaks in case you mess up your knife-log). Catch ~1.5k red chins between Kastori and Tal Teklan ( TalTeklanChinSpot.png ) . Follow this guide for catching chins: OSRS Easy 1t Hunter Guide (In-Depth) for the methods (regardless of location and chin type). Train your ranging in the MM1 tunnels (short fuse) to level 62 (55 with grey, 55-62 with red). Make sure to equip a salve amulet (ei). Optional alternative: skip this step and AFK the range training at crabs, you can even go to 70 but it is not really worth going beyond that. Second optional alternative: after getting 50 ranging with either method, do A Night at the Theatre to lamp Ranging four times (80k xp total), then use either method to train to level 62 after. You will probably need someone to carry you for A Night at the Theatre, but this is going to be true even if you go at some later point. If you have the herblore level to make ranged pots go and teleport one inventory of zamorak wines and make them all into potions, repotting frequently while chinning. Buy an upgraded device from Ava at level 50 (worth leaving for). At level 60 you can equip your mixed hide boots. Osrs 1 Def Pure Chinning guide and Experience rates and OSRS Pure Chinning Guide (Maximizing XP rates) show the mm1 tunnel method, though it is better to use a spot one curve deeper into the cave. The best location is shown (poorly) in this image . Optional: go do the Fight Caves for a fire cape. It will take quite a long time to get one, so we recommend getting one on step 27 of Chapter 3 instead. But if you feel confident and want one soon, this is the best moment. You will be doing floor 3 runs until 82 agility. Along the way you want to loot certain coffins for hallowed marks and generic loot. It is optional but recommended to continue all the way to 98 agility instead. The following coffins are recommended: On floor 3, loot the enchantment obstacle (only on the ONE side, 20240224_F3_Enchant_West.png , so on 50% of all runs). With a Hallowed focus (costs 100 hallowed marks) you will never fail the enchant and it will default to the lowest level enchantment spell you have on you. Without one the fail rate depends on the level of the spell and it will default to the highest one you have on you. It is recommended to use lvl-5 enchant before you have the focus, and lvl-3 enchant after. The XP gained for each spell is the same, regardless of level. On floor 3 each side has a grapple ( 20240224_F3_Grapple_West.png , 20240224_F3_Grapple_East.png ). You may choose to loot these right from the start, but failing them loses a lot of time. If you collect the Hallowed grapple (costs 100 hallowed marks) it is optional but not recommended to loot these until level 82 to speed up getting other loot. Floors 1-2 are not worth looting, although if you are chasing collection log slots you have to loot these too. 20240224_F2_Grapple_West.png for floor 2 and see below for floor 1. If you are using mahogany planks with rune nails (in BRUHsailer you will not be doing this) to build bridges it is efficient construction xp to build the bridge in floor 1 (on two out of four sides, so on 50% of all runs, 20240224_F1_Bridge_Coffin_West.png ) but not to cross it. Alternatively this is required if you are hunting the collection log slots. Based on the above, the recommended order for purchasing the Hallowed items is Focus > Instances > Ring > Hammer > Grapple. If you have banked vampyre ashes it is worth buying the Hallowed symbol and using them on floor 4 only. It is not efficient to collect vampyre ashes. You may always buy a few Hallowed tokens in case of a terrible run, so that you may finish it in time (and buy new tokens after). You will be doing Fletchp alch re (fletching headless arrows and casting high alchemy while moving at sepulchre). Feel free to bring the herb sack and plank sack. Maintain hourlies. It is also possible to blow glass inside the sepulchre, this is even more efficient than other multiskilling options. Most of the time is spent alching, not fletching. Once you have a little bit of cash restart misc to get teak logs for planks for building bridges (2400 total, 8 days). 10 teak 5 herb(/other) at Misc, along with 10 mahog 5 herb(/other) for future bird runs if you run low/out. Keep in mind that changing the Miscellania allocation works retroactively. Keep misc running even if you have enough planks for Sepulchre. Once you have enough planks, swap to 10 mahogany 5 herb(/other) for future construction training. As your cash stack grows just dump 7.5m in there (we will assume this going forward). You will only need these teak planks by the time you hit 82 agility, not before then. The recommended way to make planks is the Aubunvale sawmill, running between bank and sawmill using a log basket and a plank sack to make two inventories at a time. This consumes (super) energy potions or stamina potions. Alternatively, you can use the PVP world POH butler method. After Misc is up and running, buy arrow shafts and headless arrows (in smaller chunks) to get to a total of 1 million headless arrows through fletchpalchre. Alch (all) rune bolts for good magic xp along the way. We recommend buying the initial helpful items first and then spending all further hallowed marks on hallowed crystal shards (the teleports) or saving them in case of a buff/change to the shop. If you want a change of pace you can afk mine daeyalt essence for runecrafting later. There is also a high effort daeyalt ("dae-alch") method: https://streamable.com/it7kry . You can do this grind in smaller parts, or quit entirely at a lower agility level. Example setup here.

Keep in mind that changing the Miscellania allocation works retroactively.
Keep misc running even if you have enough planks for Sepulchre.

After Misc is up and running

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 74
steps.description: Do Blast Mining https://streamable.com/l3ylry to get to 330 addy ore total, buying the dynamite from the shop as needed. Hybrid ore uim smelt ( Hybrid ore UIM smelting ) your mithril from MLM. Smelt your gold ore from MLM. Use the UIM gold method ( Lazy UIM Gold ) to train your smithing to level 70, getting permission from the foreman to use the blast furnace for free at level 60. Turn all your mithril bars into platebodies (Varrock west anvils, make 10 bars into 150 nails, make a mithril 2h sword for Devious Minds and ~5 bars into grapples along the way), then alch them (similar to before). Hybrid ore uim smelt your addy (buy coal as needed) into bars. Use UIM gold to train your smithing to (15,000 xp away from) level 74. Make sure to equip your ring of charos (a) until level 60 for reduced foreman costs. Start and complete Defender of Varrock (there's a free 5k xp lamp after the quest at Historian Minas in the Varrock Museum, put it on slayer if you aren't level 58 yet and herblore otherwise). Make 4950 adamant nails (make sure to save an adamantite bar) with your bars at Varrock west anvils. Skills/quests met?: Optional: you can go to level 70-73 only and boost for making the nails instead. After this create 5 mithril grapples and complete and collect the rewards for the Ardougne medium diary, the Kandarin medium diary, the Lumbridge & Draynor medium diary (all lamps on slayer) and complete the grapple step for the Falador medium diary. Now that you have a mithril grapple you can do the quests The Curse of Arrav and The Path of Glouphrie. It is recommended to do them now, but you can also leave them for later.

instructions.text: Do Blast Mining https://streamable.com/l3ylry to get to 330 addy ore total, buying the dynamite from the shop as needed.
Hybrid ore uim smelt ( Hybrid ore UIM smelting ) your mithril from MLM.
Smelt your gold ore from MLM.
Use the UIM gold method ( Lazy UIM Gold ) to train your smithing to level 70, getting permission from the foreman to use the blast furnace for free at level 60.
Turn all your mithril bars into platebodies (Varrock west anvils
make 10 bars into 150 nails
make a mithril 2h sword for Devious Minds and ~5 bars into grapples along the way), then alch them (similar to before).

Skills/quests met?: Optional: you can go to level 70-73 only and boost for making the nails instead.

After this create 5 mithril grapples and complete and collect the rewards for the Ardougne medium diary, the Kandarin medium diary, the Lumbridge & Draynor medium diary (all lamps on slayer) and complete the grapple step for the Falador medium diary.
Now that you have a mithril grapple you can do the quests The Curse of Arrav and The Path of Glouphrie.
It is recommended to do them now, but you can also leave them for later.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 75
steps.description: Note: if you are not planning to max you can reduce this step, although the lack of prayer potions might prove to be an issue for slayer later. You will also need to obtain more planks and train construction at your own convenience if you do not go to at least level 96 agility during this step. That being said, 98 agility at Sepulchre is a loooong grind, so give serious consideration to reducing/splitting it. Read this step in its entirety carefully. This step contains a huge Hallowed Sepulchre grind. After level 82 agility you are good for a while, but there is no real reason not to continue at Sepulchre. It is optional but recommended to continue all the way to 98 agility. The following coffins are recommended: Floor 4 has a bridge (only on ONE side, 20240224_F4_Bridge.png so on 50% of all runs). With a Hallowed hammer you will never break nails while attempting to build this bridge, and it is highly recommended to buy this hammer before reaching level 82 agility. Floor 4 has an enchantment obstacle (only on ONE side, 20240224_F4_Enchant_and_Bridge.png so on 50% of all runs). This is efficient to loot barring exceptionally lucky circumstances - in practice this is always worth looting. The enchant works identically to that on floor 3. Floor 5 always has an enchantment obstacle 20240224_F5_Enchant.png , a grapple obstacle 20240224_F5_Grapple.png and a bridge obstacle 20240224_F5_Bridge.png , followed by a grand coffin 20240224_F5_Grand_Coffin.png . Every single one of these is efficient to loot. Floors 1-3 are not worth looting anymore, although if you are chasing collection log slots you have to loot these too. If you are using mahogany planks with rune nails (in BRUHsailer you will not be doing this) to build bridges it is efficient construction xp to build the bridge in floor 1 (on two out of four sides, so on 50% of all runs, 20240224_F1_Bridge_Coffin_West.png ) but not to cross it. The enchant on f3 is the best of the technically inefficient looting options, so if you want to increase your loot a little this is the one to include in your runs. You will be doing Fletchp alch re (fletching headless arrows and casting high alchemy while moving at sepulchre) all the way to 98 agility. Feel free to bring the herb sack and plank sack. Maintain hourlies. It is also possible to blow glass inside the sepulchre, this is even more efficient than other multiskilling options. Most of the time is spent alching, not fletching. After Misc is up and running, buy arrow shafts and headless arrows (in smaller chunks) to get to a total of 1 million headless arrows through fletchpalchre. Alch (all) rune bolts for good magic xp along the way. We recommend buying the initial helpful items first and then spending a lot of hallowed marks on hallowed crystal shards (the teleports). Doing this for levels 82- 98 will on average grant the following loot and xp: ~24.5m gp (not including the costs for fletching, nature runes, planks etc) 565k thieving xp, 444k construction xp, ~600k fletching xp and 3.2m magic xp (primarily through alchs). 6.1k cosmic runes (these are useful for enchanting bracelets for gp and jewellery for general use later) 8.1k death runes 44.7k law runes (these serve no long term purpose but can be used to fill a nexus, for example) 44.7k blood runes (a good initial stack for barraging during slayer) 44.7k soul runes (these have some uses for Arceuus and barrage spells, as well as being required for Tumeken's Shadow eventually) 12.7k adamant bolts (next to useless) 1100 monkfish 102 prayer potions (4) 336 sanfew serums (4) (useful at DKS and the nightmare) 152 grimy ranarr weeds 336 ranarr seeds (~2.0k (4)-dose prayer potions when farmed, a good starting supply for slayer) 72 strange lockpicks (for Barrows later, although the meta is to only do a little bit of barrows, using around 5-10 lockpicks) 2.12 Rings of Endurance (88% chance to get at least one) 16.2k hallowed teleport crystals - this is more teleports than you will likely use for banking on the road of all activities combined to maxing, so instead it is a good idea to partially save the hallowed marks (e.g. for future updates, potentially amylase) or spend it on loot sacks. If you want a change of pace you can afk mine daeyalt essence for runecrafting later. There is also a high effort daeyalt ("dae-alch") method: https://streamable.com/it7kry . You can do this grind in smaller parts, or quit entirely at a lower agility level. Example setup here. You can use Parasailer's Hallowed Sepulchre calculator: 20240115 Hallowed Sepulchre: Looting to check your loot, xp, material requirements etc. and customise your strategy. A few notes: This calculator only works for levels 82+, and does not include f1 bridge building for xp. If you wish to build this bridge adjust the number of bridges per run afterwards manually. The sheet is default set to sell law and soul runes. To fix this go into the 'High' tab (bottom left) and uncheck the boxes for selling those runes. The floor 4 brazier, 20240224_F4_Ash_Coffin.png , is not recommended as it is not efficient to collect the ash in the first place. If you already have some this is the best use for it though, after buying the hallowed symbol.

section.title: 2.2: Barbarian fishing, Green dragons and the Hallowed Sepulchre
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 76
steps.description: At your own convenience make Catherby POH tabs for your herb runs (at the lectern on Lunar Isle). If you have reached level 70 fletching at Sepulchre (or are close enough you are willing to boost for it), teleport to Seers village and complete the Kandarin Hard diary, doing all remaining steps sequentially and putting the lamp on slayer. Remember that the goal is to lamp to 58 slayer, then go back to lamping herblore. Build the following in your POH, boosting when necessary: Marble lectern Spirit tree Teak armour case Mahogany cape rack Teak fancy dress box Mahogany magic wardrobe Oak toy box Teak treasure chest One or two portal rooms (optional) (2 limestone bricks and 9 teak planks per room, plus 100x the teleport runes cost) The total item requirements for this are: 1 marble block, 1 magic stone, 1 gold leaf, 1 spirit sapling, 19 oak planks, 17 teak planks, 8 mahogany planks. If you have a fish barrel, move your POH to Brimhaven (move it back after), then buy a few thousand (between 2,000 and 10,000 recommended) raw karambwans using the barrel method in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDkz186YgME . Karambwans are the best food at all levels, and give incredible cooking xp (using a method called '1t bwan cooking'). See OSRSRecklessLadHowDoesFoodWorkV2.png for information on how food works. Without the barrel, feel free to ignore this.

instructions.text: At your own convenience make Catherby POH tabs for your herb runs (at the lectern on Lunar Isle).
If you have reached level 70 fletching at Sepulchre (or are close enough you are willing to boost for it)
teleport to Seers village and complete the Kandarin Hard diary, doing all remaining steps sequentially and putting the lamp on slayer.
Remember that the goal is to lamp to 58 slayer, then go back to lamping herblore.

Build the following in your POH, boosting when necessary: Marble lectern Spirit tree Teak armour case Mahogany cape rack Teak fancy dress box Mahogany magic wardrobe Oak toy box Teak treasure chest One or two portal rooms (optional) (2 limestone bricks and 9 teak planks per room, plus 100x the teleport runes cost) The total item requirements for this are: 1 marble block, 1 magic stone, 1 gold leaf, 1 spirit sapling, 19 oak planks, 17 teak planks, 8 mahogany planks.

If you have a fish barrel, move your POH to Brimhaven (move it back after), then buy a few thousand (between 2,000 and 10,000 recommended) raw karambwans using the barrel method in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDkz186YgME .
Karambwans are the best food at all levels, and give incredible cooking xp (using a method called '1t bwan cooking').
See OSRSRecklessLadHowDoesFoodWorkV2.png for information on how food works.
Without the barrel, feel free to ignore this.

section.title: 2.3: Wait there's even more quests? And one of them is Song of the Elves?
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 77
steps.description: Do the Mage Arena I miniquest, followed by the Mage Arena II miniquest. Pick your favourite god (Zamorak is slightly more useful than the others for protection in the God Wars Dungeon, but any choice is fine). Along the way/after mine a mithril ore at the Pirates' Hideout mine and complete a lap of the Wilderness Agility course. Kill Chaos dwarves for a muddy key, open the muddy chest in the centre of the Lava Maze. Kill an ankou at the Forgotten Cemetery, then enter the God Wars Dungeon (god wars protection is necessary!) and kill a bloodveld Optional: if you want multiple upgraded capes you can kill the bosses of Mage Arena II multiple times to obtain more capes. The staff is necessary for the wilderness hard diary. After this you can high alch the staff for some gp, if you want.

After this you can high alch the staff for some gp, if you want.

steps.title: Step 78
steps.description: (POH) teleport to Rellekka, start The General's Shadow miniquest. Teleport to Seers and speak with Sin Seer, then teleport to Rellekka and speak with the general again. Make your way to Lunar Isle. Start and complete Dream Mentor (lamp on ranged). Swap to the Lunar spellbook, teleport to Waterbirth, visit Jatizso and mine 5 adamantite ores after this step for two diary steps. POH teleport, make a super defence potion in Rellekka and collect the Fremennik hard diary, putting the lamp on herblore. Swap to Arceuus spellbook. Teleport to Draynor Manor and run out west for a scout for The General's Shadow.

Collect the Western Provinces easy and medium diaries at your own convenience, putting the lamps on herblore.

section.title: 2.3: Wait there's even more quests? And one of them is Song of the Elves?
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 2: Quests, so many quests

steps.title: Step 89
steps.description: Make sure you have a runite bar (if you do not you have three options: 1) hunt Magpie implings in Puro Puro ; 2) kill Vyrewatch Sentinels for 1/46.5; 3) trade rune platelegs for one at Nest (nice) - OSRS Wiki . This third method is recommended ). Do the entire elf quest line : Regicide, Roving Elves, Mourning's End Part I, Mourning's End Part II, Song of the Elves. Pick the crystal bow reward from Roving Elves. You have all but one item on the regular part of the 50 item list for MEPII - you are missing unicorn horn dust (and whiteberries if you didn 't save any) . Furthermore you need the randomly chosen ticket, book and key (all are easy to obtain). You may also want a spare hammer and chisel. Also make sure to farm belladonna(/nightshade) in the Draynor patch to collect at least 8 nightshades for the Seren fight (optional: use explosive liquid from the digsite instead), and also buy blood+death runes and make 6-10 phoenix necklaces. Check out the quest guides for complicated steps, use ancients + phoenix necklaces and nightshade/belladonna for the Seren fight. Rock cake and ds2 orb do work in the Seren fight, contrary to wiki and other sources. However, activating them is negated when there is a ranged projectile incoming (this is normal behaviour for these items). This means you can use them to maintain your hitpoints level, but cannot use them to proc the phoenix necklaces during special attacks. Example clip: OSRS Song of the Elves boss with phoenix necklaces (no brews) If you are really struggling with the Seren fight an alternative option is to make several Guthix Rests which don't delay your next attack when drunk, and also make it very easy to manage your HP during the fight for phoenix necklace procs. Fragment of Seren written guide explains the methods for defeating the Fragment of Seren in detail on a low level ironman.

steps.description: If you are running low on/out of (redirected) POH tabs collect more soft clay using the gravestone method in the prifddinas mine Gravestone Double Soft Clay (2400/hr) . It is recommended to collect a good stack (i.e. 500 tabs and 250 scrolls). Also make Catherby tabs for herb runs.

steps.title: Step 3
steps.description: Using your mahogany logs from Miscellania, train construction to level 75 (do not go higher for now). Build the following in your POH, boosting when necessary: Dark altar Basic jewellery box Rejuvenation pool (if you somehow have the staminas) Mahogany armour case Mahogany fancy dress box Gilded cape rack Gilded portal nexus (optional but not recommended) The total item requirements for this are: 1 Arceuus signet, 1 bolt of cloth, 1 steel bar, 3 games necklaces(8), 3 rings of dueling(8), 8 marble blocks (for the gilded portal nexus), 3 gold leaves (of which two are for the gilded portal nexus), 1 magic stone, 15 limestone bricks, 5 buckets of water, 6000 soul runes, 5000 blood runes, 1000 body runes, 10 stamina potions(4), 10 prayer potions(4), 11 mahogany planks. Note: if you want to have a rejuvenation pool (or the likes) in your POH feel free to do some rooftops, for example force spawning (see later in the guide for the best method), for marks of grace to get the required items.

steps.title: Step 4
steps.description: Now that you have daeyalt mining https://streamable.com/it7kry unlocked, mine 28k daeyalt essence (you can also just afk mine this). Make 275 binding necklaces, 175 rings of dueling, a fire tiara, buy 28k earth runes (if needed). Swap to the Lunar spellbook. Using magic imbue, your binding necklaces and hallowed crystal shards (teleports) for banking, lava runecraft to 425,000 xp (level 64, midway to level 65). After this, start and complete The Final Dawn, putting the xp on prayer. The Arkan blade is now your default special attack weapon when meleeing. It is stronger than the dragon dagger. The Arkan blade is also sometimes better (typically against stab weak enemies) than the Dragon scimitar as a mainhand weapon. Complete the Lumbridge Hard diary, putting the lamp on herblore. Complete the Ardougne Hard diary (also requires a shield left half).

steps.title: Step 5
steps.description: Camp Cave Horrors off-task for a black mask (protect melee allows an amulet of strength, so use your regular slayer gear, proselyte hauberk versus torso is fine either way, use thralls, take your herb sack). Start and complete the Morytania Hard diary (lamp on herblore). Visit Robin twice a day with 13 bones each time to collect 130 ectotokens for bonecrusher charges (3250 charges per day - you will need 24k charges to complete step 12 of this chapter) - collect the bones on any slayer task (for example regular/big/baby dragon). Imbue your black mask at the PVP Arena ( imbue scroll via pvp arena - losing method ) or nightmare zone. An example setup (except for the black mask and expeditious bracelets, obviously) is cave-horrors.png . The recommended spot is cave-horrors.png (northwest from the entrance).

section.title: 3.1: Slayer and the red prison
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 6
steps.description: Buy 2300 sand (the goal is to get to level 70 crafting, each sand is approximately 88.1 xp) from the grinder (buy bucket packs as needed, e.g. at Alice's farming shop near the ectofuntus). Superglass Make them into glass (18:3 no pickup). Blow all the glass into unpowered orbs doing artefacts, i.e. doing arteglass, to get to level 70 crafting. Do Pyramid Plunder for one (or two, it is recommended to get the second at/after level 91 thieving) sceptre(s) using the sceptre + xp method - all chests, sarcs in level 51+ rooms, urns in the level 81 room optional. Collect gold artefacts along the way - just bank them when your inv fills up, you'll only need ~200 or so later. Example setup for xp method pyramid plunder. World hop to find a world with a North mummy room. The mummy resets every now and again, hop to find a new world. On all but the last room do chest and sarc first then check the doors, ignore the urns. On the last room do urns first, then chest, then sarc, then leave. If you haven't already, it is worth making ~100 superantipoison potions (kill cows, for example at the crafting guild, to get cowhides, then use the Tower of Life to make unicows for noted unicorn horns, then make superantipoison potions). You can use a gravestone method to transfer the supplies required to the Tower of Life, though this requires a decent (28-42) initial supply of both hides and horns so it is probably not useful for just this step. Use (super) energy potions and/or vile vigour for this. If you want to get full graceful first you could force spawn for it, though it's not as good without the Ardougne elite diary.

Superglass Make them into glass (18:3 no pickup).
Blow all the glass into unpowered orbs doing artefacts, i.e. doing arteglass, to get to level 70 crafting.

Do Pyramid Plunder for one (or two, it is recommended to get the second at/after level 91 thieving) sceptre(s) using the sceptre + xp method - all chests, sarcs in level 51+ rooms, urns in the level 81 room optional.
Collect gold artefacts along the way - just bank them when your inv fills up, you'll only need ~200 or so later.
Example setup for xp method pyramid plunder.
World hop to find a world with a North mummy room.
The mummy resets every now and again, hop to find a new world.
On all but the last room do chest and sarc first then check the doors, ignore the urns.
On the last room do urns first, then chest, then sarc, then leave.

If you haven't already, it is worth making ~100 superantipoison potions (kill cows, for example at the crafting guild, to get cowhides, then use the Tower of Life to make unicows for noted unicorn horns, then make superantipoison potions).

You can use a gravestone method to transfer the supplies required to the Tower of Life, though this requires a decent (28-42) initial supply of both hides and horns so it is probably not useful for just this step.
Use (super) energy potions and/or vile vigour for this.
If you want to get full graceful first you could force spawn for it, though it's not as good without the Ardougne elite diary.

section.title: 3.1: Slayer and the red prison
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 7
steps.description: Train slayer to get to 100cb. Your target stats are 78 Attack, 85 Strength, 75(+) Defence and 72(+) prayer, which should probably give you 78(+)Hitpoints and ~75 Slayer around the time you hit 100cb. Keep Strength around 10-15 levels ahead of Attack until it hits 83. At level 75 Attack make Arclight. Generally you only use accurate/aggressive/shared and get your bulk defence xp from defensive cast barrage tasks. Use piety whenever you're using melee. If you get an amulet of glory from dragon imps along the way use it for magic slayer tasks, not melee ones. Unlock Broader Fletching. If you happen to get to a good slayer point situation, purchase the slayer helmet and complete the Desert Hard diary. At level 90 magic you can use divine magic potions to stay at level 94 for entire (barrage) tasks and use ice barrage, if not you'll have to use smoke barrage for ankou/dust devils and ice burst for dagannoths. Make sure to cast the spells on defensive. Check out 20251019SlayerGuide for advice on efficient slayer at this point. If you (somehow) do not have runes for thralls or barrage, buy them. Use your Pharaoh's sceptre to teleport to the ancient magicks pyramid (Jaldraocht) to swap to the ancient spellbook when needed, and your POH Dark altar to swap to Arceuus when needed. When your sceptre is at 1 charge teleport to Pyramid Plunder (Jalsavrah) with 6 gold artefacts to recharge it to 25 charges. At your own convenience, complete the quest While Guthix Sleeps along the way. Grab the 100 magic logs during the quest for Shades of Mort'ton (for bloodbark) later. Alternatively, postpone the quest until after the Corrupted Gauntlet. Along the way you will hit milestones for the following diaries, complete them at your convenience along the way, putting all lamps on herblore: At any point: save a shield left half (if you get one) for the Ardougne Hard diary 62 slayer - Kourend Hard diary 68 slayer - Wilderness Hard diary 72 slayer - Falador Hard diary Slayer Helmet - Desert Hard diary This also requires killing the Kalphite Queen. One of the more efficient ways to do this is by using thralls only, since this also completes the Combat Achievements task of only attacking with a Verac's Flail. See 0 HP XP Kalphite Queen (Thralls) OSRS or OSRS 'Prayer Smasher' Elite Combat Achievement - Without Verac's Flail for example kills. Keep in mind you need to splash all the grasp attacks. 100 combat level - Karamja Hard diary After completing the Karamja Hard diary, mine gems in the underground gem mine, cut them in the bank, sell them for trading sticks at Gabooty (10 opal/10 jade/1 red topaz per world, wear your Karamja gloves ) to get 100k trading sticks. In total this takes 520 cut opals, 520 cut jades and 52 red topazes (keep additional red topaz and a good amount of opals for slayer bracelets. Buy to a total of 10k karambwans at Tiadeche (using a Ring of Endurance, Vile Vigour and three client hopping for the best rates), banking with Rionasta's parcel service. Video: Shopscape Karambwans . Do the Kourend & Kebos Hard diary (lamp on RC), then cook the karambwans at your convenience (1t cooking at the Hosidius range is best, cooking gauntlets do not work on karambwans). If you previously bought bwans in Chapter 2, you won't need as many now. Only buy the difference (or postpone it for later, if you wish). Alternatively, use the (less macroefficient but faster) Yazota/Brimhaven POH portal method for buying bwans https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDkz186YgME ) instead, which requires the fish barrel. 100 combat level - Western Provinces Diary (included for completeness, ignore this diary for now). Along the way complete a long list of Combat Achievement diary tasks, exported to a separate document for readability. 20240131CombatAchievementPointReworkCA shows a list of all tasks that can be included at or before this step. CA's during Chapter 3 step 07 is an older document going into more detail on the slayer-related tasks (but note that some of these are no longer recommended!). If you are missing any of these tasks by the time you reach 100cb, go do them (stew boosting slayer as necessary). Collect the easy and medium Combat Achievement rewards, lamping herblore. Complete His Faithful Servants along the way.

instructions.text: Train slayer to get to 100cb.
Your target stats are 78 Attack, 85 Strength, 75(+) Defence and 72(+) prayer, which should probably give you 78(+)Hitpoints and ~75 Slayer around the time you hit 100cb.
Keep Strength around 10-15 levels ahead of Attack until it hits 83.
At level 75 Attack make Arclight.
Generally you only use accurate/aggressive/shared and get your bulk defence xp from defensive cast barrage tasks.
Use piety whenever you're using melee.
If you get an amulet of glory from dragon imps along the way use it for magic slayer tasks, not melee ones.
Unlock Broader Fletching.
If you happen to get to a good slayer point situation, purchase the slayer helmet and complete the Desert Hard diary.

At level 90 magic you can use divine magic potions to stay at level 94 for entire (barrage) tasks and use ice barrage, if not you'll have to use smoke barrage for ankou/dust devils and ice burst for dagannoths.
Make sure to cast the spells on defensive.
Check out 20251019SlayerGuide for advice on efficient slayer at this point.
If you (somehow) do not have runes for thralls or barrage
buy them.
Use your Pharaoh's sceptre to teleport to the ancient magicks pyramid (Jaldraocht) to swap to the ancient spellbook when needed, and your POH Dark altar to swap to Arceuus when needed.
When your sceptre is at 1 charge teleport to Pyramid Plunder (Jalsavrah) with 6 gold artefacts to recharge it to 25 charges.
At your own convenience
complete the quest While Guthix Sleeps along the way.
Grab the 100 magic logs during the quest for Shades of Mort'ton (for bloodbark) later.
Alternatively, postpone the quest until after the Corrupted Gauntlet.
Along the way you will hit milestones for the following diaries

complete them at your convenience along the way, putting all lamps on herblore: At any point: save a shield left half (if you get one) for the Ardougne Hard diary 62 slayer - Kourend Hard diary 68 slayer - Wilderness Hard diary 72 slayer - Falador Hard diary Slayer Helmet - Desert Hard diary This also requires killing the Kalphite Queen.
One of the more efficient ways to do this is by using thralls only, since this also completes the Combat Achievements task of only attacking with a Verac's Flail.
See 0 HP XP Kalphite Queen (Thralls) OSRS or OSRS 'Prayer Smasher' Elite Combat Achievement - Without Verac's Flail for example kills.
Keep in mind you need to splash all the grasp attacks. 100 combat level - Karamja Hard diary After completing the Karamja Hard diary
mine gems in the underground gem mine
cut them in the bank
sell them for trading sticks at Gabooty (10 opal/10 jade/1 red topaz per world
wear your Karamja gloves ) to get 100k trading sticks.
In total this takes 520 cut opals, 520 cut jades and 52 red topazes (keep additional red topaz and a good amount of opals for slayer bracelets.
Buy to a total of 10k karambwans at Tiadeche (using a Ring of Endurance, Vile Vigour and three client hopping for the best rates), banking with Rionasta's parcel service.
Video: Shopscape Karambwans .
Do the Kourend & Kebos Hard diary (lamp on RC), then cook the karambwans at your convenience (1t cooking at the Hosidius range is best, cooking gauntlets do not work on karambwans).
If you previously bought bwans in Chapter 2, you won't need as many now.
Only buy the difference (or postpone it for later, if you wish).
Alternatively

use the (less macroefficient but faster) Yazota/Brimhaven POH portal method for buying bwans https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zDkz186YgME ) instead, which requires the fish barrel. 100 combat level - Western Provinces Diary (included for completeness, ignore this diary for now).

Along the way complete a long list of Combat Achievement diary tasks, exported to a separate document for readability. 20240131CombatAchievementPointReworkCA shows a list of all tasks that can be included at or before this step.
CA's during Chapter 3 step 07 is an older document going into more detail on the slayer-related tasks (but note that some of these are no longer recommended!).
If you are missing any of these tasks by the time you reach 100cb
go do them (stew boosting slayer as necessary).
Collect the easy and medium Combat Achievement rewards, lamping herblore.
Complete His Faithful Servants along the way.

steps.title: Step 8
steps.description: Optional but recommended: collect buckets of sand and giant seaweed to train your crafting level to 80 (or 75, boosting after) using SGM and arteglass. Make an amulet of glory. Regardless of whether you include the above: buy broad arrowhead packs with most of your money (leave ~500k in reserve, buy the broad arrowtip packs at any slayer master, if you are opening fast enough the stock will slowly deplete. Hop worlds if the stock ever hits 700 or lower). Do Pest Control, veteran i.e. 100+ cb boat, for enough points for full elite void range (other two helmets optional) while fletching - 1250 points for just ranging, 1650 points for a full set, fletching during the games and only contributing as much as necessary to get points. You can optionally get the other two helmets as well, or ignore them(/consider getting them later).

steps.title: Step 9
steps.description: Do the Fremennik Exiles, A Night at the Theatre (lamps on ranging), Hopespear's Will. Start Monkey Madness II until you have access to Kruk's Dungeon (with the Maniacal monkeys). If you don't have the fremennik shield yet, get it from Bardur with a ring of charos (a).

Start Monkey Madness II until you have access to Kruk's Dungeon (with the Maniacal monkeys).

get it from Bardur with a ring of charos (a).

steps.title: Step 10
steps.description: Optional but recommended: with the Karamja Hard diary completed, 3t gem mine to level 97 mining ( gems route ), banking the uncut gems using the deposit box. This requires a charged amulet of glory. With multiskill cutting the gems (see below) this is more efficient than 3t4g. This requires a charged amulet of glory! If you make one here you won't have to make one next step. You may skip this step if you don't value multiskilling or efficiency enough to take such a long detour/don't feel like it.

section.title: 3.1: Slayer and the red prison
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 11
steps.description: Go to Guardians of the Rift, participate in the minigame with the multiskilling method until you are completely out of uncut gems. Guardians of the Rift - multiskilling - this video shows a simple example of multiskill Guardians of the Rift - you still make combination runes, but focus on skilling rather than participating throughout most of the game (in fact, you only enter the west essence mine when it opens and ignore all other opportunities to collect essence). The best way to multiskill is by carrying a gem bag full with uncut gems (60 sapphires, emeralds, rubies and diamonds) into the minigame, taking them out of the gem sack, cutting them and depositing them at the Deposit Pool (which acts as a regular deposit box!) one inventory at a time. The point and xp rate will be lower than active GotR, but the crafting xp makes it more efficient. An important strategy to increase your points per game (and per hour) at guardians of the rift is 'empty cell running'. When out of essence, grab a cell from the table and enter an altar (higher tier is better) to charge the cell. Then deposit it for points, ideally on a golem but on a barrier is also fine. You can combine this with multiskilling for efficiency. Make an amulet of glory when you have the crafting level (75+5) to make one.

section.title: 3.1: Slayer and the red prison
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 12
steps.description: Catch 20k red chinchompas between Tal Teklan and Kastori TalTeklanChinSpot.png or 16k black chinchompas (for 92 ranged, if you have extras then can consider throwing for more Ranged XP or using them for your first fire cape if you're good at speed strats) in the wilderness. Follow this guide for catching chins: OSRS Easy 1t Hunter Guide (In-Depth) . If you want to catch red chinchompas but the Varlamore spot is too competitive, e.g. with bots, the second best option is catching them northeast of Prifddinas. Throw the chins in the cave to get to 70 ranging, complete the Western Provinces Hard Diary (this involves getting one Zulrah kill), upgrade your void to Elite, (optionally: grab an offtask fire cape at some point along the way), return and throw the chins to get to level 92 ranging. Make sure to use ranging potions and a bonecrusher (with at least 24k charges), your elite void ranged, mixed hide boots, a berserker ring (i), an amulet of strength, a crystal halberd for speccing, a mixed hide cape and carry death charge runes. Also note that chins are not lost in death, so you could carry more and extend the trip. Use medium fuse. Use protect melee and eagle eye, the regular potion drops will maintain your prayer (but bring a few to be safe, along with a teleport out). Also note that chins are not lost in death, so you could carry more and extend the trip. Example setup for catching chins. Example setup for throwing chins. However, this gear is outdated - use mixed hide boots, a berserker ring (i), an amulet of strength, a crystal halberd for speccing, a mixed hide cape and carry death charge runes. Example setup for Zulrah diary kill , using blood barrage(/blitz). https://streamable.com/l64fsw example kill. Pre-99 Chinchompa Calculator for checking the numbers. If you want to go for a lower ranged level https://i.imgur.com/j291MJI.png shows the max hits of the corrupted bow (t3 bow in the corrupted gauntlet) by level with eagle eye, levels 89 and 87 are reasonable alternative stopping points. This will make CG more difficult and slower and also reduce your max hits once you do get the bow though. If you do not want to train with chinchompas (which are best by far) you could alternatively afk it in the nightmare zone. The nightmare zone has super ranging pots, making it the best afk ranged training method by far. The recommended afk range NMZ method is: Wear (elite) void, a magic shortbow (i), rune arrows, amulet of glory, shayzien boots (5). Use the Hawk Eye (10%) prayer, no overhead. Rock cake(/DS2 orb) down to 1hp, use absorption potions, repeat this approximately every 6-9 minutes (it's fine to go to higher health in between and lose more absorption charges, the goal is to have it afk. Some other guides will recommend resetting every minute or flicking rapid heal, this is a waste of time). Use the super ranging potions (duh), resetting along with the rock cake + absorption pots + prayer pot sips (for hawk eye). Use hard custom rumble (not standard!). Bitterkoekje's DPS Calculator has a tab for NMZ DPS on set 1, so verify for yourself. Generally the recommended list of enemies is: Moss Giant Sand Snake Count Draynor King Roald Witch's Experiment (this choice might depend on level, use the DPS calculator to verify). Optional and not recommended: you could detour for a zombie axe from armoured zombies at Zemouregal's Fort (the higher level ones are better) with barrage spells, then use that along with a rune crossbow at the Royal Titans, specifically Eldric the Ice King, with the goal of unlocking the Deadeye prayer. This allows you to reduce the ranged level target from 92 to 89. Alternatively, you can knock out this scroll (and the other one) after CG, getting much faster kills.

section.title: 3.1: Slayer and the red prison
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 13
steps.description: Do Corrupted Gauntlet for 6 armour seeds and one enhanced weapon seed (~70 hours) (tip: use longrange on staff hits for defence xp - alternatively you can use accurate for ~0.5% more accuracy, but we think the def xp is more valuable). Maintain hourlies as usual. You should be level 93 ranging after this step. On average, this will also give the following loot: 2,960 crystal shards (it costs 2,300 shards to make a full set of crystal armour and a corrupted Bow of Faerdhinen - train smithing as necessary using GP from CG, see step 17 below - plus the armour needs charges). On droprate you will get another 580 shards (on top of the 2,800) from trading in excess armour and (regular) weapon seeds (into acorns, grown and chopped down for 14-16 shards each with ultracompost). 51.5m gp profit in gp and assorted alchs (500 battlestaves for which you need to charge orbs, 500 diamonds that need crafting first) - it is recommended to make diamond and ruby bracelets but only cut (and then ignore) lower tier gems. Making ruby bracelets has an effective gp/hr rate of 9m, which is low enough you can consider ignoring them. 506k crafting xp from cutting and crafting gems and making air battlestaves. 10,6k cosmic runes, 6.9k nature runes, 6.4k law runes, 13.8k chaos runes (sell these for tokkul for future onyxes to make zenytes), 7.5k death runes, 6.3k blood runes 62.5k mithril arrows, 30.6k adamant arrows, 17.5k rune arrows, 3.8k dragon arrows If you get 6 armour shards and an enhanced weapon seed way earlier, just leave and make up for the lack of gp and resources elsewhere. The Corrupted Gauntlet is only worth for the sake of grinding the Bow of Faerdhinen and its armour. How to Farm the Corrupted Gauntlet | Lower your Average Time to 8 Minutes! shows a good guide on completing the Corrupted Gauntlet with t1 prep. It is recommended to immediately aim for t1 armour, rather than first learning t2 armour methods and then unlearning those bad habits when settling into the grind later. Important note: the food advice in this video guide is incorrect, the timing of eating does not matter (with some minor exceptions). It is highly recommended to safe up , i.e. eat every time your HP is 21 or more below your max health at Hunllef. See also OSRSRecklessLadHowDoesFoodWorkV2.png . McClumpy CG Prep shows an easier approach to t1 prep including prescouting (it is highly recommended to prescout regardless of what else you choose to go for), sacrificing a bit of time per prep to gain lots of consistency. Corrupted Gauntlet - prepping t1 shows a (lousy) example run by the author. During the Hunllef fight focus on positioning > overheads > eating and drinking egniol > attacking > offensive prayers. In general you want to be near the middle of the room, so that Hunllef is standing between you and the edge of the room. This gives you maximum flexibility for moving around later.

steps.title: Step 14
steps.description: Go to Guardians of the Rift, participate in the minigame until you have the full Raiments of the Eye and the colossal pouch. Guardians of the Rift - multiskilling - this video shows a simple example of multiskill Guardians of the Rift - you still make combination runes, but focus on skilling rather than participating throughout most of the game (in fact, you only enter the west essence mine when it opens and ignore all other opportunities to collect essence). The best way to multiskill is by carrying a gem bag full with uncut gems (60 sapphires, emeralds, rubies and diamonds) into the minigame, taking them out of the gem sack, cutting them and depositing them at the Deposit Pool (which acts as a regular deposit box!) one inventory at a time. The point and xp rate will be lower than active GotR, but the crafting xp makes it more efficient. If you are out of/low on uncut gems, instead do: Guardians of the Rift - mass world, 4 pouches, combination runes (the same method as before). An important strategy to increase your points per game (and per hour) at guardians of the rift is 'empty cell running'. When out of essence, grab a cell from the table and enter an altar (higher tier is better) to charge the cell. Then deposit it for points, ideally on a golem but on a barrier is also fine. You can combine this with multiskilling for efficiency. At 65 runecrafting complete the Ardougne Hard diary (also requires a shield left half). After completing the full outfit and the colossal pouch, consider going for full bloodbark to help with future slayer. It is the most convenient to obtain +1% magic damage gear.

section.title: 3.2: Quest cape, quality of life
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 15
steps.description: Do While Guthix Sleeps if you haven't already. Start and complete Dragon Slayer II (using your Bow of Faerdhinen to deal with the strong bosses - protect from magic and antifire potions will, when combined, provide decent dragonfire protection except against metal dragons and Galvek where you need the shield plus a rune crossbow), putting Ellen's XP at the end on Strength. Kill Vorkath up to 50 times to get an Ava's Assembler. Complete Monkey Madness II (put Duke's xp on Strength).

instructions.text: Do While Guthix Sleeps if you haven't already.

Start and complete Dragon Slayer II (using your Bow of Faerdhinen to deal with the strong bosses - protect from magic and antifire potions will, when combined, provide decent dragonfire protection except against metal dragons and Galvek where you need the shield plus a rune crossbow), putting Ellen's XP at the end on Strength.
Kill Vorkath up to 50 times to get an Ava's Assembler.
Complete Monkey Madness II (put Duke's xp on Strength).

section.title: 3.2: Quest cape, quality of life
section.chapterTitle: Chapter 3: The longest home stretch you've ever seen

steps.title: Step 16
steps.description: Do Devious Minds, then Secrets of the North (a bowfa is pretty strong against, well, everything). Do Beneath Cursed Sands (did you know the bowfa works very well against these enemies) and Into the Tombs (don't make me say it). The best use for the lamp is on strength. Optional but recommended: kill the Phantom Muspah(/Grumbler) for an ancient icon to upgrade your ancient staff (make some mithril sapphire bolts (e) and a rune crossbow for the smite phase). Start and complete Desert Treasure II, putting the xp on prayer. Collect a quest cape. Your best weapons for the four bosses are: Vardorvis: Arkan blade (this is going to be rough) Duke Sucellus: Arclight Leviathan: Bow of Faerdhinen Whisperer: The strongest Earth spell you can cast (just don't stand in the wave bro)

instructions.text: Do Devious Minds, then Secrets of the North (a bowfa is pretty strong against, well, everything).
Do Beneath Cursed Sands (did you know the bowfa works very well against these enemies) and Into the Tombs (don't make me say it).
The best use for the lamp is on strength.
Optional but recommended: kill the Phantom Muspah(/Grumbler) for an ancient icon to upgrade your ancient staff (make some mithril sapphire bolts (e) and a rune crossbow for the smite phase).
Start and complete Desert Treasure II, putting the xp on prayer.
Collect a quest cape.

steps.title: Step 17
steps.description: Use the money from CG to train smithing to level 86 with UIM gold. You'll need to buy around 42.3k gold ores to get 86 Smithing for all diaries. Convert your cut diamonds and rubies into bracelets (optionally also enchant them, this is technically only worth it if you find a way to '0time' it though) and charge enough unpowered orbs to match your battlestaves, then alch those/cash those in (e.g. at artefacts). Optional: also include ruby bracelets. Optional: you can also train to 'just' level 83, so you can +5 for the Lumbridge Elite diary. This takes approximately 29.9k gold ores. Optional: complete the Ardougne Elite Diary 'make a rune crossbow from scratch' step. If you have the rest of the stats complete the Ardougne Elite diary, this requires doing NMZ for imbuing a salve amulet. Optional but recommended: force spawn some marks of grace, bankstanding processing resources you have (e.g. herbs) to make staminas to help with smithing. Using super energy potions is also fine, and the dropping method of UIM gold doesn't require any at all.

steps.title: Step 18
steps.description: Get a fire cape off task (if you don't have one yet). Note: there are many strategies for getting a fire cape. Some suggestions include: Bring blood barrage to heal during the waves, carry your food to the Jad fight. Bring vengeance and brews and deliberately tank a mage frog hit regularly to speed up the caves. Bring thralls, recasting whenever you move to increase your dps (expensive but fast). Bring spellbook swap, vengeance and thralls to combine 2+3. You can find an example setup for the fight caves here. If you have divine ranged potions, use those.

steps.title: Step 19
steps.description: Get a dragon pickaxe (if you intend on going for at least partial completion of the Combat Achievements then just hop bosses while going for kc at each of them). If you plan on getting a Voidwaker later you will most likely get multiple dragon pickaxes along the way - the recommended bosses for that are Artio, Spindel and Vet'ion. Alternatively you may wish to postpone it for when you go for the Kq head, hoping to get one along the way. This is a setup for fbow chaos elemental. , this method is fast if you don't care for the voidwaker.
